Use the ContentResolver class to retrieve tracks on the device through the MediaStore.Audio.Media class. Use android.provider.MediaStore.Audio.Media.ALBUM to identify albums. The app need to bind to the music playing Service in order to interact with playback.
Include in Android Manifest: android.permission.WAKE_LOCK. \nUse the MediaPlayer class to play audio and the MediaController class to control playback.

Use links to the webpages of the music services listed above, as we don\'t know if relevant apps are installed on the user\'s phone. The one exception is Google Play, for which access can be set up using an Intent.

A list of recently played tracks, by track id, is stored and called for display in this screen. The list is displayed here and called for playback using the MediaPlayer and the MediaController classes.

The music player control functionality will be implemented using the MediaController class. \nAllocate a track id to each song in the list, to be used in calling the playback and storing the recently played items.
